intro: Cordula violascens, commonly known as the violetleaf cordula, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and related trees. The plant is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, violet-colored flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
